titleStmt.title: Divine and politike observations nevvly translated out of the Dutch language, vvherein they vvere lately divulged. Upon some lines in the speech of the Arch. B. of Canterbury, pronounced in the Starre-Chamber upon 14. June, 1637. Very expedient for preventing all prejudice, which as well through ignorance, as through malice and flattery, may be incident to the judgement which men make thereby, either of his Graces power over the Church, and with the King, or of the equity, justice, and wisdome of his end in his said speech, and of the reasons used by him for attaining to his said end
titleStmt.author: Theophilus, fl. 1638.

publicationStmt.date: in the yeare of our Lord MDC.XXXVIII. [1638]

notesStmt.note: "The translators [i.e. author's] dedicatory epistle" signed: Theophilus.
A reply to: Laud, William. A speech delivered in the Starr-Chamber, on Wednesday, the XIVth of June, MDCXXXVII.
"Doubtless not a translation, but first written in English."--Collins, W.E. Lectures on Archbishop Laud, p.193, no. 86.
Place of publication and identification of printer from STC.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
